artist: Artist: Natori Shunsen; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
description: portrait of a serious-looking young samurai with crossed arms; black kimono; green ground
markings: red artist\'s seal: 春仙 {Shunsen} | publisher seal: 版元東京銀座渡辺木版画舗 {hanmoto Tōkyō Ginza Watanabe mokuhan gaho}  (publisher Tokyo Ginza Watanabe woodblock print store)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Tenth design of a set of 36. Based on Ichikawa Sumizō VI (1886-1971) as Shirai Gonpachi In the scene "Suzugamori" 鈴ヶ森 of the play "Ukiyozuka hiyoku no inazuma" 浮世柄比翼稲妻 (The floating world's pattern and matching lightning bolts), performed at the Asakusa Shōchiku Theater, January 1925.
title: Actor Ichikawa Sumizō VI as Shirai Gonpachi
